job_description:
Associate Analyst - Hyderabad

Company: GlobalLogic

Location: Hyderabad, India

About the Role:

GlobalLogic is seeking recent graduates to join our team as Associate Analysts in our Hyderabad office. This is an on-site position offering a fantastic opportunity to launch your professional journey in a dynamic and growing company. As an Associate Analyst, you will be working with text-based content, performing tasks such as reviewing, interpreting, summarizing, and handling straightforward textual assignments. This role requires a strong command of written and spoken English, meticulous attention to detail, and the ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.

Responsibilities:

  • Accurately interpret and process written information from various sources, including documents, articles, and online content.
  • Rewrite and summarize content while preserving essential meaning and context.
  • Identify recurring themes, key insights, and important details within documents.
  • Assess the reliability and quality of written materials, identifying potential biases or inaccuracies.
  • Produce clear, concise, and well-organized summaries, reports, or other textual outputs.
  • Manage time effectively to complete assigned tasks on time and meet quality expectations.
  • Collaborate effectively with teammates and supervisors, contributing to a positive and productive work environment.
  • Actively seek feedback and demonstrate a commitment to continuous learning and professional development.
  • Adapt to evolving work methods, tools, and responsibilities with a flexible and positive attitude.
  • Maintain a high level of professionalism and accuracy in all tasks and interactions.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in any discipline (preference given to candidates with backgrounds in English, Journalism, or Humanities).
  • Strong command of both written and spoken English, demonstrating excellent grammar, punctuation, and vocabulary.
  • Fresh graduates are encouraged to apply.
  • Proven analytical and reasoning skills, with the ability to identify patterns and draw logical conclusions from textual information.
  • Proficiency in standard office tools, including MS Word, Google Docs, and other relevant software.
  • Excellent attention to detail and strong time management skills.
  • Flexibility to work in rotational shifts if needed.
  • Willingness to work from the GlobalLogic office in Hyderabad.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities for Associate Analyst at GlobalLogic

Textual Analysis and Processing:

  • Interpret and Summarize: Accurately comprehend written information from various sources and condense it into concise summaries while preserving the core meaning and context. This may involve summarizing articles, reports, emails, or other textual materials.
  • Identify Themes and Insights: Analyze text to detect recurring patterns, trends, and key insights. This could involve identifying common topics, sentiments, or opinions expressed within a set of documents.
  • Evaluate Source Reliability: Assess the credibility and quality of written materials by considering factors such as source reputation, author expertise, and potential biases.

Content Rewriting and Formatting:

  • Rewrite for Clarity and Conciseness: Reword existing text to improve clarity, readability, and conciseness while maintaining the original message. This may involve simplifying complex language, restructuring sentences, or eliminating redundant information.
  • Produce Reports and Summaries: Compile findings from textual analysis into well-organized reports or summaries, using clear headings, bullet points, and concise language.

Collaboration and Professionalism:

  • Teamwork and Communication: Collaborate effectively with teammates and supervisors, sharing information, ideas, and progress updates.
  • Feedback Receptiveness: Actively seek and incorporate feedback from supervisors and colleagues to improve performance and develop skills.
  • Adaptability and Growth: Embrace new work methods, tools, and responsibilities, demonstrating a willingness to learn and adapt to evolving demands.
  • Accuracy and Timeliness: Complete assigned tasks accurately and within established deadlines, consistently meeting quality expectations.
  • Professional Conduct: Maintain a high level of professionalism in all interactions, demonstrating respect for colleagues, clients, and company policies.

5. Offer and Onboarding (Duration: 2 weeks)

  • What happens: The selected candidate receives a formal job offer outlining compensation, benefits, and start date. Successful candidates undergo onboarding procedures, including paperwork, training, and introductions to the team.
  • Who's involved: HR team, hiring manager, and the new employee.

This comprehensive selection process ensures GlobalLogic hires the best-suited candidates for the Associate Analyst role, contributing to the company's success.

qualification:
Ernst & Young Associate Analyst: Typical Qualifications & Requirements

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree: A minimum of a Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field is typically required. This foundational education provides a strong understanding of financial principles, analytical methods, and business concepts essential for success as an Associate Analyst.
  • Master's Degree (Preferred): While not always mandatory, a Master's degree in Business Administration (MBA) or a specialized Master's in Finance or Accounting can be highly advantageous. It demonstrates advanced knowledge and analytical capabilities, potentially leading to faster career progression.

Skills:

  • Analytical Skills: Associate Analysts are expected to possess strong analytical skills to interpret financial data, identify trends, and draw meaningful conclusions. This involves proficiency in using financial modeling tools, conducting data analysis, and presenting findings clearly and concisely.
  • Communication Skills: Effective communication is crucial for collaborating with clients, colleagues, and senior management. Associate Analysts must be able to articulate complex financial information in a clear and understandable manner, both verbally and in writing.
  • Technical Skills: Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (especially Excel), financial modeling software, and data analysis tools is essential. Familiarity with accounting software and databases is also beneficial.
  • Problem-Solving Skills: Associate Analysts often encounter complex financial challenges. They need to be able to think critically, identify root causes, and develop effective solutions.

Experience:

  • Internships: Relevant internships in finance, accounting, or consulting are highly valued. They provide practical experience and exposure to industry best practices.
  • Entry-Level Experience: While not always required, some prior work experience in a related field can be beneficial. This could include roles in financial analysis, accounting, or data entry.

Other Requirements:

  • Attention to Detail: Accuracy is paramount in financial analysis. Associate Analysts must be meticulous and have a strong eye for detail to ensure the integrity of their work.
  • Teamwork: Associate Analysts often work in teams on complex projects. Strong teamwork skills and the ability to collaborate effectively are essential.
  • Professionalism: Ernst & Young values professionalism and ethical conduct. Associate Analysts are expected to maintain a high level of professionalism in all interactions.
job_description:
Associate Analyst - Tax

Company: Ernst & Young (EY)

Location: [City, State]

About the Opportunity

Join EY, a global leader in assurance, consulting, strategy, and transactions, and be at the forefront of building a better working world. As an Associate Analyst in our Tax practice, you will play a vital role in assisting clients with their tax needs, leveraging your analytical skills and knowledge to deliver high-quality work and advice. This role offers a dynamic environment where you can learn, grow, and contribute to a collaborative team while building valuable relationships with clients.

Your Key Responsibilities

  • Tax Research and Analysis: Conduct thorough tax research utilizing relevant databases and resources to stay abreast of current tax laws and regulations. Apply research findings to specific client situations, ensuring compliance and identifying potential tax optimization opportunities.
  • Tax Return Preparation: Assist in the preparation of accurate and timely tax returns for individuals and/or corporations, utilizing tax software and adhering to strict deadlines.
  • Client Communication: Develop strong client service skills by effectively communicating with clients, understanding their needs, and providing clear and concise explanations of complex tax concepts.
  • Team Collaboration: Work collaboratively with senior team members, sharing knowledge, contributing to project discussions, and supporting the overall success of the team.
  • Special Projects: Participate in special projects as assigned, contributing to the development and implementation of innovative tax solutions for clients.

Skills and Attributes for Success

  • Analytical Skills: Demonstrate strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, capable of interpreting complex financial information and identifying potential tax implications.
  • Communication Skills: Possess excellent written and verbal communication skills, effectively conveying technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Technical Proficiency: Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, including Excel, Word, and PowerPoint. Familiarity with tax software applications is a plus.
  • Attention to Detail: Maintain a high level of accuracy and attention to detail, ensuring the completeness and correctness of all tax-related documentation.
  • Teamwork: Collaborate effectively within a team environment, contributing to a positive and supportive work atmosphere.

To Qualify for the Role, You Must Have

  • A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.

Ideally, You’ll Also Have

  • Prior internship experience in a tax-related role.
  • Knowledge of relevant tax laws and regulations.
  • Strong organizational and time management skills.

What We Look For

EY seeks individuals with a strong work ethic, a commitment to excellence, and a passion for learning. We value diversity and inclusion, and we are committed to creating a workplace where everyone feels welcome and respected.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities of an Associate Analyst at Ernst & Young (Tax)

This section outlines the core duties and responsibilities expected of an Associate Analyst within the Tax department at Ernst & Young.

Tax Research and Application:

  • Conduct in-depth tax research: Utilize various resources, including tax codes, regulations, and legal precedents, to gather information relevant to specific client situations.
  • Apply research findings to client needs: Analyze research results and translate them into practical solutions for clients, ensuring compliance with applicable tax laws and regulations.
  • Stay abreast of tax developments: Continuously monitor changes in tax legislation, rulings, and industry best practices to ensure accuracy and up-to-date knowledge.

Tax Return Preparation and Analysis:

  • Analyze financial information: Review client financial statements, transactions, and other relevant documents to identify tax implications and potential areas of concern.
  • Prepare accurate tax returns: Utilize tax software and knowledge of tax codes to prepare complete and accurate tax returns for individuals, corporations, or other entities.
  • Review and verify tax calculations: Double-check calculations, ensure accuracy, and identify potential discrepancies or areas requiring further investigation.

Client Service and Collaboration:

  • Develop strong client service skills: Communicate effectively with clients, understand their needs, and provide clear and concise explanations of complex tax matters.
  • Collaborate with team members: Work effectively within a team environment, sharing knowledge, contributing to project discussions, and supporting colleagues.
  • Assist Seniors and Managers: Provide support to senior team members on special projects, research assignments, or client engagements as needed.

Other Responsibilities:

  • Maintain confidentiality: Handle sensitive client information with discretion and adhere to strict confidentiality protocols.
  • Meet deadlines: Deliver high-quality work within established timeframes and prioritize tasks effectively.
  • Contribute to a positive work environment: Foster a collaborative and supportive atmosphere within the team.
about_company:
About Ernst & Young

Ernst & Young (EY) is a global leader in assurance, consulting, strategy, and transactions, serving clients in more than 150 countries. With a rich history spanning over 70 years, EY has built a reputation for delivering high-quality services and innovative solutions to organizations of all sizes.

Mission and Values:

EY is driven by a purpose to build a better working world. This commitment is reflected in their core values: integrity, quality, respect, and collaboration. They strive to create long-term value for their clients, people, and society by fostering an environment of trust, transparency, and accountability.

Market Position and Growth Trajectory:

As one of the "Big Four" accounting firms, EY holds a dominant position in the global professional services market. They are recognized for their expertise in a wide range of industries, including financial services, technology, energy, and healthcare. EY continues to invest in innovation and talent development, driving its growth trajectory and expanding its service offerings to meet evolving client needs.

Culture and Employee Experience:

EY fosters a dynamic and inclusive culture that values diversity and encourages continuous learning. They offer a comprehensive range of development programs and opportunities for career advancement, empowering their employees to reach their full potential. EY is committed to creating a workplace where everyone feels valued, respected, and supported.
selection_process:
Ernst & Young: Associate Analyst Selection Process

This multi-stage process aims to identify candidates with the necessary skills, knowledge, and cultural fit for the Associate Analyst role at Ernst & Young.

1. Application Review (Duration: 1 week)

  • What happens: Candidates submit their resumes and cover letters through the EY careers portal. The recruitment team reviews applications, screening for relevant qualifications, experience, and skills outlined in the job description.
  • Who's involved: Recruitment team members.
  • Evaluation criteria: Education, relevant experience, skills, and alignment with job requirements.
  • Candidate expectations: Submit a well-structured resume and cover letter highlighting relevant skills and experiences.

2. Phone Screening (Duration: 1-2 days)

  • What happens: Shortlisted candidates are contacted for a brief phone interview to assess their communication skills, motivation, and basic understanding of the role.
  • Who's involved: Recruitment team member or HR representative.
  • Evaluation criteria: Communication skills, enthusiasm, understanding of EY and the role, and alignment with company culture.
  • Candidate expectations: Be prepared to discuss their background, career goals, and interest in EY.

3. Online Assessments (Duration: 2-3 days)

  • What happens: Candidates complete online assessments designed to evaluate their analytical, problem-solving, and technical skills relevant to the role.
  • Who's involved: Candidates complete assessments independently.
  • Evaluation criteria: Analytical reasoning, problem-solving abilities, attention to detail, and technical proficiency.
  • Candidate expectations: Allocate sufficient time to complete the assessments thoroughly and accurately.

4. First-Round Interview (Duration: 1-2 weeks)

  • What happens: Candidates shortlisted after the assessments participate in a virtual or in-person interview with a hiring manager or senior team member. This interview delves deeper into their experience, skills, and suitability for the role.
  • Who's involved: Hiring manager or senior team member.
  • Evaluation criteria: Technical skills, problem-solving abilities, communication skills, cultural fit, and potential for growth.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare for behavioral questions, technical questions related to the role, and questions about their career aspirations.

5. Second-Round Interview (Duration: 1-2 weeks)

  • What happens: Candidates who successfully navigate the first round may participate in a second interview with a wider team, including potential colleagues and senior leaders. This stage focuses on assessing their fit within the team and the company culture.
  • Who's involved: Hiring manager, team members, and potentially senior leaders.
  • Evaluation criteria: Teamwork skills, communication style, cultural fit, and alignment with EY values.
  • Candidate expectations: Demonstrate enthusiasm for the role, the team, and EY's mission.

6. Offer and Onboarding (Duration: 1-2 weeks)

  • What happens: Selected candidates receive a formal job offer outlining compensation, benefits, and start date. Successful candidates then undergo onboarding procedures, including paperwork, orientation, and introductions to the team and company resources.
  • Who's involved: Recruitment team, HR, and the hiring manager.
  • Evaluation criteria: Candidate acceptance of the offer and successful completion of onboarding procedures.
  • Candidate expectations: Review the offer carefully, ask clarifying questions, and actively participate in onboarding activities.

qualification:
Roche Software Engineering Intern: Qualifications & Requirements

This section outlines the typical qualifications and requirements for a Software Engineering Intern position at Roche.

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field: A strong foundation in computer science principles is essential for understanding software development methodologies, data structures, and algorithms.
  • Expected Graduation Date: Roche typically seeks interns who will graduate within the next 12-18 months, ensuring a smooth transition into a potential full-time role.

Technical Skills:

  • Proficiency in at least one programming language (e.g., Java, Python, C++): Interns will be involved in coding tasks, requiring a solid understanding of syntax, data types, and control flow.
  • Familiarity with software development methodologies (e.g., Agile, Scrum): Roche utilizes Agile methodologies for project management, so interns should be comfortable working in iterative development cycles and collaborating in a team environment.
  • Basic understanding of databases and SQL: Interns may interact with databases to retrieve and manipulate data, requiring a foundational knowledge of database concepts and SQL queries.

Soft Skills:

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills: Software engineering involves identifying and resolving complex technical challenges, demanding critical thinking and analytical abilities.
  • Excellent communication and teamwork skills: Interns will collaborate with other engineers, project managers, and stakeholders, necessitating clear and concise communication.
  • Self-motivation and eagerness to learn: Roche values interns who are proactive, take initiative, and demonstrate a strong desire to expand their knowledge and skills.

These qualifications provide a framework for aspiring software engineers to demonstrate their suitability for an internship at Roche.
job_description:
Software Engineering Intern

Company: Roche

Location: [City, State]

About Roche Information Solutions

Roche Information Solutions is a leading provider of healthcare IT solutions, leveraging digital transformation and AI to empower healthcare professionals and improve patient care. We are dedicated to developing innovative software applications that address the evolving needs of the healthcare industry.

Position Overview

Roche Information Solutions is seeking highly motivated and talented individuals to join our software engineering team as interns. This is an exceptional opportunity for proactive and enthusiastic candidates eager to launch their careers in software development. Interns will gain valuable practical experience working with cutting-edge technologies, contributing to the creation of web applications that support oncologists and enhance healthcare IT.

Key Responsibilities

  • Application Development: Contribute to the development and enhancement of web-based applications using Java Spring Boot for server-side functionality and React for user interfaces. This includes writing clean, efficient, and well-documented code, adhering to coding standards and best practices.
  • Collaborative Development: Work closely with multidisciplinary teams, including product managers, designers, and other engineers, to understand functional requirements and deliver effective software solutions tailored to the needs of healthcare users.
  • Software Development Lifecycle: Participate in the full software development lifecycle, from planning and design to development, testing, and deployment. This provides exposure to various stages of software development and fosters a comprehensive understanding of the process.
  • Learning and Implementation: Learn and implement industry-standard software engineering best practices, including agile development methodologies, version control systems (e.g., Git), and testing frameworks.
  • Innovation and AI: Support projects that incorporate artificial intelligence and digital tools to deliver innovative healthcare solutions. This offers the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and contribute to the advancement of healthcare through technology.

Qualifications

  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
  • Strong understanding of object-oriented programming principles and experience with Java or a similar object-oriented language.
  • Familiarity with front-end development technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
  • Experience with React or other JavaScript frameworks is a plus.
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
  • Strong communication and teamwork skills.
  • Passion for software development and a desire to learn and grow.
key_responsibility:
Software Engineering Intern - Key Responsibilities

Application Development

  • Build and Enhance Web Applications: Develop and refine web applications using Java Spring Boot for backend logic and React for user interfaces. This involves writing clean, efficient code, adhering to coding standards, and ensuring seamless integration between frontend and backend components.
  • Implement Functional Requirements: Translate user stories and functional specifications into working software features. This requires a strong understanding of software design principles and the ability to translate complex requirements into technical solutions.

Team Collaboration and Project Lifecycle

  • Collaborate with Multidisciplinary Teams: Work effectively within cross-functional teams comprising developers, designers, product managers, and subject matter experts. This involves active communication, participation in brainstorming sessions, and contributing to the overall project success.
  • Participate in the Software Development Lifecycle: Engage in all stages of the software development process, from initial planning and design to development, testing, deployment, and maintenance. This provides a comprehensive understanding of the software development workflow and fosters a holistic approach to software engineering.

Technical Skills and Best Practices

  • Learn and Implement Best Practices: Adhere to established software engineering best practices, including agile development methodologies, version control systems (e.g., Git), and code review processes. This ensures the development of high-quality, maintainable, and scalable software solutions.
  • Explore AI and Digital Tools: Contribute to projects that leverage artificial intelligence and digital technologies to enhance healthcare solutions. This exposes interns to cutting-edge technologies and provides opportunities to learn and apply them in a real-world context.
about_company:
About Roche

Roche is a global pioneer in pharmaceuticals and diagnostics, driven by a passion for advancing healthcare and improving the lives of patients worldwide. As the world's largest biotech company, Roche leverages cutting-edge science and technology to develop innovative solutions for some of the most pressing health challenges facing humanity.

Mission and Values:

At the heart of Roche lies a commitment to "Do no harm" and "Do good." This guiding principle permeates every aspect of their operations, from research and development to manufacturing and distribution. Roche fosters a culture of collaboration, innovation, and integrity, empowering its employees to make a meaningful impact on the world.

Market Position and Growth Trajectory:

Roche holds a leading position in the global healthcare industry, with a strong presence in both pharmaceuticals and diagnostics. Their diverse portfolio encompasses a wide range of therapies and diagnostic tools, addressing diseases such as cancer, infectious diseases, and autoimmune disorders. Roche continues to invest heavily in research and development, driving innovation and expanding its reach into new therapeutic areas.

Commitment to Software Engineering:

Roche recognizes the critical role of software engineering in advancing healthcare. The company actively seeks talented individuals to join its growing software engineering team, contributing to the development of innovative digital health solutions that enhance patient care and improve healthcare outcomes.
selection_process:
Roche Software Engineering Intern Selection Process

This multi-stage process aims to identify candidates with strong technical skills, collaborative spirit, and a passion for healthcare technology.

1. Application Screening (1 week)

  • What happens: Candidates submit resumes and cover letters through the Roche career portal. The team reviews applications for relevant technical skills (Java, Spring Boot, React), academic background, and alignment with Roche's values.
  • Who's involved: HR team and hiring manager.
  • Duration: 1 week.
  • Evaluation criteria: Technical skills, relevant experience, academic achievements, cover letter quality, and cultural fit.
  • Candidate expectations: Submit a well-crafted resume and cover letter highlighting relevant skills and experiences.

2. Online Coding Assessment (2 weeks)

  • What happens: Shortlisted candidates complete a timed online coding assessment platform (e.g., HackerRank, Codility) testing their problem-solving abilities and proficiency in Java and related technologies.
  • Who's involved: Hiring manager and technical team.
  • Duration: 2 weeks (including submission and review time).
  • Evaluation criteria: Code quality, efficiency, problem-solving approach, and adherence to best practices.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare for a technical assessment focusing on Java and web development concepts.

3. Technical Interview (1 week)

  • What happens: Candidates selected from the coding assessment participate in a technical interview with a software engineer. The interview delves deeper into technical skills, project experience, and understanding of software development methodologies.
  • Who's involved: Software engineer from the team.
  • Duration: 1 week (including scheduling and interview).
  • Evaluation criteria: Technical knowledge, problem-solving skills, communication abilities, and cultural fit.
  • Candidate expectations: Be prepared to discuss technical projects, demonstrate coding knowledge, and answer questions about software development practices.

4. Behavioral Interview (1 week)

  • What happens: Candidates who successfully complete the technical interview participate in a behavioral interview with an HR representative or hiring manager. This interview assesses soft skills, teamwork, communication, and alignment with Roche's values.
  • Who's involved: HR representative or hiring manager.
  • Duration: 1 week (including scheduling and interview).
  • Evaluation criteria: Communication skills, teamwork, problem-solving, adaptability, and cultural fit.
  • Candidate expectations: Be prepared to discuss past experiences, provide examples of teamwork and problem-solving, and demonstrate alignment with Roche's values.

5. Decision and Offer (1 week)

  • What happens: The hiring team reviews all interview feedback and makes a final decision. The selected candidate receives a formal job offer outlining the terms and conditions of employment.
  • Who's involved: Hiring manager and HR team.
  • Duration: 1 week.
  • Evaluation criteria: Overall performance across all stages, technical skills, soft skills, cultural fit, and alignment with team needs.
  • Candidate expectations: Receive a formal job offer and negotiate terms if necessary.

qualification:

job_description:
Graduate Engineer Trainee - Invesco

About Invesco

Invesco is a global independent investment management firm dedicated to delivering an investment experience that helps people get more out of life. With offices in over 20 countries, Invesco manages over $1.5 trillion in assets on behalf of clients worldwide.

Job Summary

Invesco is seeking highly motivated and talented individuals to join our Graduate Engineer Trainee program. This program provides a structured and comprehensive learning experience for recent graduates, equipping them with the skills and knowledge necessary to succeed in a dynamic investment management environment. Trainees will gain hands-on experience in various aspects of the business, working closely with experienced professionals and contributing to real-world projects.

Responsibilities

  • Report Generation: Prepare client reports on a scheduled basis (daily, weekly, monthly, or quarterly) by consolidating data from multiple systems and teams. Ensure the accuracy and timely delivery of reports within established deadlines.
  • Client Support: Respond promptly and effectively to routine client inquiries, providing support for basic issues and escalating complex matters to senior team members.
  • Process Transition: Assist in the transition of tasks from regional offices, ensuring a smooth and efficient handover of responsibilities.
  • Documentation: Contribute to the creation and maintenance of detailed and accurate process documentation, enhancing operational efficiency and knowledge sharing.
  • System Testing: Support local teams during system testing phases and periods of high workload, contributing to the stability and reliability of critical systems.
  • Communication: Maintain open communication with the Team Lead or Manager, promptly reporting any critical concerns or unusual findings.

Skills and Experience

  • Financial Knowledge: Possess a foundational understanding of financial markets, asset types, mutual fund structures, investment processes, and key market stakeholders.
  • Teamwork: Demonstrate strong team collaboration skills, effectively contributing to a shared work environment.
  • Communication: Exhibit excellent communication and interpersonal abilities, both written and verbal.
  • Attention to Detail: Maintain a high level of attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and precision in all tasks.
  • Adaptability: Demonstrate flexibility and willingness to adapt to changing priorities and work demands.
  • Technical Proficiency: Possess basic proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Excel.

Educational Qualifications

  • MBA in Finance: Graduating in 2025 from a recognized institute.
  • Academic Record: Minimum of 60% marks in 10th, 12th, and undergraduate studies.
  • Academic Standing: No ongoing academic backlogs.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities for Graduate Engineer Trainee at Invesco

This role focuses on providing operational support within Invesco's engineering team, contributing to client reporting, communication, and process improvement.

Client Reporting & Communication:

  • Generate Client Reports:
    • Compile data from various internal systems and teams to produce accurate client reports on a scheduled basis (daily, weekly, monthly, or quarterly).
    • Ensure timely delivery of reports within designated deadlines.
    • Example: Prepare a weekly performance report for clients, summarizing fund performance, market trends, and key investment metrics.
  • Respond to Client Inquiries:
    • Address routine client inquiries promptly and professionally.
    • Provide clear and concise answers to basic questions regarding account information, fund details, or investment processes.
    • Escalate complex inquiries to senior team members as needed.

Operational Support & Process Improvement:

  • Task Transition & Support:
    • Assist in the smooth transition of tasks from regional offices to the central team.
    • Provide support to local teams during system testing phases or periods of high workload.
  • Process Documentation:
    • Contribute to the creation and maintenance of detailed and accurate process documentation for various engineering tasks and workflows.
    • Ensure documentation is up-to-date and readily accessible to team members.
  • Compliance & Quality:
    • Adhere strictly to all reporting procedures and organizational policies.
    • Maintain high standards of accuracy and precision in all work deliverables.
  • Communication & Feedback:
    • Keep the Team Lead or Manager informed of any critical concerns, unusual findings, or potential issues that may impact operations.

This role offers a valuable opportunity for recent graduates to gain practical experience in the financial services industry, develop technical skills, and contribute to a dynamic team environment.
about_company:
About Invesco

Invesco is a global independent investment management firm dedicated to delivering an investment experience that helps people get more out of life. With offices in over 20 countries and a team of over 8,000 employees, Invesco manages over $1.4 trillion in assets across a wide range of investment strategies and products.

A Legacy of Innovation:

Founded in 1985, Invesco has a long history of innovation in the investment management industry. The firm is known for its expertise in active and passive investment strategies, including equity, fixed income, and alternative investments. Invesco's commitment to research and development ensures they stay at the forefront of market trends and deliver cutting-edge investment solutions to clients worldwide.

Client-Centric Approach:

Invesco prioritizes building strong, long-term relationships with clients. They believe in understanding individual needs and tailoring investment solutions to meet specific financial goals. This client-centric approach has earned Invesco a reputation for trust and reliability among investors of all levels.

A Culture of Growth:

Invesco fosters a dynamic and inclusive work environment that encourages professional development and innovation. The firm is committed to providing its employees with the resources and opportunities they need to succeed. This dedication to growth extends to the company's overall strategy, with Invesco constantly seeking new ways to expand its global reach and enhance its investment offerings.
selection_process:

This multi-stage process aims to identify candidates with the necessary skills, knowledge, and cultural fit for the Graduate Engineer Trainee role at Invesco.

1. Application Screening (1 week)

qualification:
Analyst – Data Analytics at KPMG: Typical Qualifications & Requirements

This section outlines the typical qualifications and requirements for an Analyst – Data Analytics position at KPMG.

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree: A Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related discipline is essential.
    • Why: This foundation provides the necessary analytical and problem-solving skills crucial for data analysis.
    • How it applies: A strong understanding of statistical concepts, data structures, and algorithms is directly applicable to analyzing large datasets and drawing meaningful insights.
    • Proficiency: A Bachelor's degree is the minimum requirement.

Technical Skills:

  • Programming Languages: Proficiency in at least one programming language commonly used in data analysis, such as Python or R, is essential.
    • Why: These languages are widely used for data manipulation, cleaning, visualization, and modeling.
    • How it applies: Analysts use these languages to automate tasks, build analytical models, and generate reports.
    • Proficiency: Demonstrated experience in writing clean, efficient code and applying relevant libraries (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn) is expected.
  • Data Visualization Tools: Familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms is highly desirable.
    • Why: Effective communication of insights is crucial. Data visualization tools enable analysts to present complex data in a clear and understandable manner.
    • How it applies: Analysts use these tools to create interactive dashboards, reports, and presentations that effectively communicate data-driven findings.
    • Proficiency: Experience in creating compelling visualizations and telling stories with data is beneficial.
  • Databases & SQL: Understanding of relational databases and SQL querying is important for accessing and manipulating data.
    • Why: Most data resides in databases. SQL skills are essential for extracting relevant information for analysis.
    • How it applies: Analysts use SQL to query databases, join tables, and retrieve specific data points needed for their analyses.
    • Proficiency: Ability to write efficient SQL queries and understand database structures is expected.

Soft Skills:

  • Analytical Thinking: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills are crucial for identifying patterns, drawing conclusions, and making data-driven recommendations.
  • Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills are essential for effectively conveying findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Teamwork: Ability to collaborate effectively with colleagues, clients, and stakeholders is important in a team-oriented environment.

These qualifications provide a strong foundation for success as an Analyst – Data Analytics at KPMG.
job_description:
Analyst – Data Analytics at KPMG

About the Role

KPMG is seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Analyst to join our dynamic EDD (Enhanced Due Diligence) team. In this role, you will play a crucial part in conducting comprehensive due diligence assessments for international KPMG teams and clients. You will collaborate with a team of analysts and executives to manage projects, ensuring timely and accurate delivery of critical information.

Responsibilities

  • Conduct Integrity Due Diligence, Counterparty Due Diligence, and Senior Management Due Diligence checks to evaluate reputation, regulatory, and jurisdictional risks for clients.
  • Utilize a variety of online sources, including commercial registries, corporate databases, and news platforms in multiple languages to gather relevant information.
  • Translate and summarize findings from foreign language sources into concise, accurate English reports.
  • Deliver time-sensitive and insightful reports to clients, effectively leveraging research and analytical skills.
  • Contribute to the development and improvement of EDD methodologies and processes.

Qualifications

  • Required Skills:
    • Proven proficiency in secondary research techniques, including online database searches and information synthesis.
    • Basic understanding of accounting principles and financial statement analysis.
    • Familiarity with regulatory frameworks, corporate structures, complex ownership breakdowns, and external research methodologies.
    • Experience with OFAC & negative news screening databases (e.g., LexisNexis, World Check, Dow Jones, Google News) and corporate registries.
    • Ability to translate and summarize foreign language content into clear, accurate English.
  • Preferred Skills:
    • Bachelor's degree in Commerce or a related field.
    • 0-1 year of relevant experience in a similar role, preferably in professional services firms, third-party KPOs, or internal research/strategy teams within technology companies.
    • Demonstrated ability to work independently with appropriate supervision from Team Lead/Assistant Manager/Manager.
    • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex information clearly and concisely.
    • Strong attention to detail and adaptability in dynamic environments with shifting priorities and tight deadlines.
    • Resilience and drive to overcome challenges and achieve team/project/client objectives.
    • Ability to maintain confidentiality and demonstrate personal integrity.
    • Strong work ethic and commitment to delivering high-quality service.
    • Proficiency in a foreign language is a plus.
key_responsibility:
Analyst – Data Analytics - Key Responsibilities

Due Diligence & Risk Assessment

  • Conduct Integrity Due Diligence, Counterparty Due Diligence, and Senior Management Due Diligence checks: This involves meticulously researching individuals and entities to evaluate their reputation, regulatory compliance, and potential jurisdictional risks.
    • Expected Outcome: Provide comprehensive risk assessments to clients, informing their decision-making processes and mitigating potential financial and reputational harm.
  • Utilize online resources for research: Leverage a variety of databases, including commercial registries, corporate databases, and news sources, to gather relevant information about clients and their stakeholders.
    • Expected Outcome: Compile a thorough and accurate understanding of the client's background, operations, and potential red flags.

Information Gathering & Analysis

  • Conduct secondary research: Employ effective research techniques to gather information from publicly available sources, including online databases, news articles, and regulatory filings.
    • Expected Outcome: Identify key facts, trends, and potential risks associated with the client or individual under review.
  • Translate and summarize foreign language content: Accurately translate and condense information from various languages into concise, clear English reports.
    • Expected Outcome: Ensure all relevant information is accessible and understandable to the client and internal stakeholders.

Reporting & Communication

  • Deliver time-sensitive reports: Prepare and deliver comprehensive reports to clients within agreed-upon deadlines, ensuring accuracy and clarity.
    • Expected Outcome: Provide clients with timely and actionable insights to support their decision-making processes.
  • Collaborate with team members: Work effectively with analysts and executives to manage projects and ensure seamless delivery of services to clients.
    • Expected Outcome: Contribute to a collaborative and efficient team environment, fostering knowledge sharing and best practices.

About KPMG

KPMG is a global network of professional services firms providing Audit, Tax, and Advisory services. With a presence in over 145 countries and over 236,000 professionals, KPMG is dedicated to delivering exceptional client experiences and driving sustainable growth.

Mission and Values:

selection_process:
KPMG Analyst – Data Analytics Hiring Workflow

This multi-stage process aims to identify candidates with the necessary skills, experience, and cultural fit for the Analyst – Data Analytics role at KPMG.

1. Application Screening (Duration: 1 week)

  • What happens: Candidates submit their resumes and cover letters through the KPMG job portal.
  • Who's involved: Recruitment team members review applications against pre-defined criteria outlined in the job description.
  • Evaluation criteria: Relevance of experience, skills, education, and language proficiency.
  • Candidate expectations: Submit a well-structured resume and cover letter highlighting relevant experience and skills.

2. Online Assessments (Duration: 2 days)

  • What happens: Shortlisted candidates complete online assessments testing their research, analytical, and language skills.
  • Who's involved: Candidates and the assessment platform provider.
  • Evaluation criteria: Accuracy, speed, and attention to detail in completing the assessments.
  • Candidate expectations: Allocate sufficient time to complete the assessments thoroughly.

3. Video Interview (Duration: 1 week)

  • What happens: Candidates participate in a pre-recorded video interview answering specific questions related to the role and KPMG.
  • Who's involved: Candidates and a member of the recruitment team.
  • Evaluation criteria: Communication skills, clarity of thought, and alignment with KPMG values.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare thoughtful answers to common interview questions and ensure a professional video recording setup.

4. In-Person Interview (Duration: 1 week)

  • What happens: Top candidates are invited for an in-person interview with a hiring manager and potentially other team members.
  • Who's involved: Candidates, hiring manager, and potentially other team members.
  • Evaluation criteria: Technical skills, problem-solving abilities, cultural fit, and potential for growth.
  • Candidate expectations: Research the company and role thoroughly, prepare insightful questions, and dress professionally.

5. Reference Checks (Duration: 1 week)

  • What happens: KPMG contacts references provided by the candidate to verify their experience and work ethic.
  • Who's involved: Recruitment team and candidate references.
  • Evaluation criteria: Confirmation of candidate's skills, experience, and professional conduct.
  • Candidate expectations: Provide accurate and up-to-date contact information for references.

6. Offer and Onboarding (Duration: 1 week)

  • What happens: The selected candidate receives a formal job offer outlining compensation and benefits.
  • Who's involved: Recruitment team and the candidate.
  • Evaluation criteria: Candidate's acceptance of the offer and completion of onboarding procedures.
  • Candidate expectations: Carefully review the offer details and communicate any questions or concerns promptly.

This comprehensive selection process ensures KPMG hires the best talent for the Analyst – Data Analytics role, aligning with the company's commitment to excellence and client satisfaction.

qualification:
Goldman Sachs Summer Analyst: Typical Qualifications & Requirements

Academic Background

  • Bachelor's Degree: A bachelor's degree from a top-tier university is typically required. This demonstrates a strong foundation in analytical thinking, problem-solving, and communication skills, essential for success in finance.
  • Major: While not strictly required, majors in finance, economics, mathematics, computer science, or related fields are highly preferred. These majors provide a strong theoretical and practical understanding of financial markets, quantitative analysis, and technology, which are crucial for the role.
  • GPA: A high GPA (typically 3.5 or above) is generally expected. This reflects academic excellence and the ability to handle rigorous coursework, a key indicator of potential success in a demanding environment like Goldman Sachs.

Skills & Experience

  • Analytical Skills: Summer Analysts are expected to analyze financial data, identify trends, and develop recommendations. Strong analytical skills, including the ability to interpret complex information and draw logical conclusions, are essential.
  • Financial Modeling: Proficiency in financial modeling using tools like Excel is crucial. Analysts will build models to assess investment opportunities, analyze financial statements, and support deal structuring.
  • Communication Skills: Effective written and verbal communication is vital for interacting with colleagues, clients, and senior management. Analysts must clearly articulate their findings, recommendations, and ideas.
  • Teamwork: Summer Analysts work in teams on various projects. Strong teamwork skills, including collaboration, active listening, and the ability to contribute effectively to group discussions, are essential.
  • Problem-Solving: The ability to identify and solve problems independently and creatively is highly valued. Analysts often face complex challenges and need to develop innovative solutions.

Other Requirements

  • Leadership Potential: Goldman Sachs seeks individuals who demonstrate leadership qualities, initiative, and a strong work ethic.
  • Cultural Fit: Candidates should align with Goldman Sachs' values of integrity, excellence, and teamwork.

This comprehensive breakdown provides a clear understanding of the typical qualifications and requirements for a Summer Analyst position at Goldman Sachs.
job_description:
Summer Analyst - Engineering

Company: Goldman Sachs

Location: Bengaluru, Hyderabad

Program Start Date: July 2025

About the Program

Goldman Sachs' Engineering Analyst Campus Hiring Program offers a unique opportunity for final-year engineering students in India to launch their careers in the dynamic world of finance. This intensive program provides a comprehensive introduction to the firm's engineering division, exposing participants to advanced technology projects and fostering collaboration with experienced professionals.

Responsibilities

Summer Analysts will be involved in a variety of projects, including:

  • Software Development: Contributing to the development and maintenance of critical financial systems and applications.
  • Data Analysis: Utilizing data analysis techniques to identify trends, patterns, and insights within financial data.
  • Technical Support: Providing technical support to internal stakeholders and resolving system-related issues.
  • Process Improvement: Identifying opportunities to streamline and improve engineering processes.

Qualifications

  • Final-year engineering students graduating in 2025.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Proficiency in at least one programming language (e.g., Java, Python, C++).
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to work effectively in a team environment.

Application Process

  • Registration: Applications open on March 7, 2025, and close on March 23, 2025.
  • Assessment: Candidates will undergo a series of assessments designed to evaluate their technical and analytical abilities.
  • Interviews: Shortlisted candidates will participate in multiple rounds of interviews with engineering professionals.

Benefits

  • Gain valuable experience working on cutting-edge technology projects in the financial industry.
  • Develop technical and professional skills through mentorship and training programs.
  • Network with experienced professionals and build lasting relationships.
  • Opportunity for a full-time position in the Engineering division at Goldman Sachs, India, upon successful completion of the program.
key_responsibility:
Goldman Sachs Summer Analyst: Key Responsibilities

While the provided job description focuses on the application process and program overview, we can infer typical responsibilities for a Summer Analyst role at Goldman Sachs based on industry standards.

Technical Project Support:

  • Assisting Senior Engineers: Summer Analysts will work closely with experienced engineers on various technology projects within the Engineering division. This involves understanding project requirements, conducting research, and providing technical support as needed.
  • Coding and Development: Depending on the specific project, Summer Analysts may be involved in writing code, testing functionalities, and debugging existing systems. This could involve utilizing various programming languages and software development tools relevant to the project.
  • Documentation and Reporting: Summer Analysts will contribute to documenting project progress, technical specifications, and user manuals. They may also be responsible for preparing reports summarizing project findings and recommendations.

Business Analysis and Research:

  • Market Research and Analysis: Summer Analysts may be tasked with conducting market research to understand industry trends, competitor analysis, and emerging technologies relevant to Goldman Sachs' operations.
  • Financial Modeling and Analysis: They may assist in building financial models to analyze investment opportunities, assess risk, and support decision-making processes within the firm.
  • Data Analysis and Visualization: Summer Analysts may be involved in analyzing large datasets, identifying patterns, and creating visualizations to communicate insights to stakeholders.

Professional Development:

  • Networking and Mentorship: The program will provide opportunities for Summer Analysts to network with senior professionals, attend industry events, and participate in mentorship programs to enhance their professional development.
  • Training and Skill Development: Goldman Sachs will offer training programs and workshops to equip Summer Analysts with the necessary skills and knowledge to succeed in their roles and prepare for future career growth within the firm.

These responsibilities provide a general framework for the expectations of a Summer Analyst at Goldman Sachs. The specific tasks and projects assigned will vary depending on the individual's skills, interests, and the needs of the Engineering division.

selection_process:
Goldman Sachs Summer Analyst Selection Process

This multi-stage process evaluates candidates for the Summer Analyst program at Goldman Sachs, focusing on analytical, technical, and interpersonal skills.

1. Application Review (March 7 - March 23, 2025)

  • What happens: Applications are screened against eligibility criteria (final-year students graduating in 2025).
  • Who's involved: Recruiting team at Goldman Sachs.
  • Duration: 2 weeks.
  • Evaluation criteria: Academic record, relevant coursework, extracurricular activities, and resume alignment with job description.
  • Candidate expectations: Submit a complete and accurate application by the deadline.

2. Online Assessments (March 26 - April 9, 2025)

  • What happens: Shortlisted candidates complete online assessments covering quantitative aptitude, logical reasoning, technical skills (programming, data analysis), and situational judgment.
  • Who's involved: Candidates and automated assessment platform.
  • Duration: 2 weeks.
  • Evaluation criteria: Performance on each assessment section, demonstrating problem-solving, analytical, and technical abilities.
  • Candidate expectations: Allocate sufficient time for each assessment and demonstrate strong performance.

3. Video Interviews (April 16 - April 30, 2025)

  • What happens: Top-performing candidates participate in pre-recorded video interviews, answering behavioral and technical questions.

  • Evaluation criteria: Communication skills, clarity of thought, problem-solving approach, and alignment with Goldman Sachs values.

4. Superday Interviews (May 7 - May 14, 2025)

qualification:
Associate Software Engineer at Firstsource: Qualifications & Requirements

This section outlines the typical qualifications and requirements for an Associate Software Engineer position at Firstsource.

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field: A strong foundation in computer science principles is essential for understanding software development methodologies, data structures, and algorithms.
  • Relevant coursework: Courses in object-oriented programming, data structures, algorithms, software design, and databases are highly desirable.

Technical Skills:

  • Programming Languages: Proficiency in at least one object-oriented programming language like Java, Python, or C# is crucial. The ability to write clean, efficient, and well-documented code is paramount.
  • Software Development Methodologies: Familiarity with Agile development methodologies (Scrum, Kanban) is essential for collaborating effectively in a fast-paced environment.
  • Version Control Systems: Experience with Git or similar version control systems is necessary for managing code changes and collaborating with other developers.
  • Databases: Basic understanding of relational databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL) and SQL is required for interacting with and manipulating data.

Soft Skills:

  • Problem-solving: Associate Software Engineers must be able to analyze problems, identify root causes, and develop effective solutions.
  • Communication: Clear and concise communication, both written and verbal, is essential for collaborating with team members, stakeholders, and clients.
  • Teamwork: The ability to work effectively in a team environment is crucial for successful software development.
  • Adaptability: The technology landscape is constantly evolving, so the ability to learn new technologies and adapt to changing requirements is essential.

These qualifications provide a strong foundation for success as an Associate Software Engineer at Firstsource.
job_description:
Associate – Software Engineer at Firstsource

Company Overview:

Firstsource is a global business process management company specializing in providing customer experience, data analytics, and technology solutions. With a strong focus on innovation and customer satisfaction, Firstsource empowers businesses to achieve their strategic objectives.

Position Summary:

Firstsource is seeking a talented and motivated Associate Software Engineer to join our dynamic development team. The successful candidate will play a key role in designing, developing, and deploying innovative software solutions across various platforms, including cloud-based environments. This position requires a strong foundation in software engineering principles, proficiency in programming languages, and a passion for delivering high-quality, user-centric applications.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Software Development: Design, develop, and implement software applications across front-end (web/desktop), back-end (Java/.NET/Python), and database layers.
  • Agile Development: Collaborate effectively within an agile development environment, participating in sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives.
  • Testing and Deployment: Adhere to best practices in software testing (unit, integration, regression) and deployment, ensuring the delivery of robust and reliable applications.
  • Technical Expertise: Stay abreast of emerging technologies and industry trends, actively seeking opportunities to expand technical knowledge and skills.
  • Communication and Collaboration: Effectively communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, fostering strong teamwork and collaboration.

Required Skills:

  • Programming Proficiency: Demonstrated expertise in at least one of the following programming languages: Java, .NET, Python, or Node.js.
  • Front-End Development: Strong understanding of JavaScript and experience with popular front-end frameworks such as Angular, ReactJS, or ASP.NET.
  • Database Management: Experience working with relational database management systems (RDBMS) like Oracle, SQL Server, or PostgreSQL, coupled with solid SQL skills.
  • Cloud Computing: Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS or Azure, and experience deploying and managing applications in cloud environments.
  • Version Control: Proficiency in using version control systems like Git for code management and collaboration.
  • DevOps Practices: Understanding of DevOps principles and tools, such as Azure DevOps, for continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD).

Preferred Skills:

  • Experience with containerization tools like Docker.
  • Exposure to AI/ML libraries such as scikit-learn, Keras, or PyTorch.
  • Basic knowledge of statistical analysis and mathematical modeling techniques.
key_responsibility:

This section outlines the core duties and responsibilities expected of an Associate – Software Engineer at Firstsource.

Software Development

  • Application Design and Development:

selection_process:
Firstsource - Associate Software Engineer Hiring Workflow

This multi-stage process aims to identify candidates with the technical skills, problem-solving abilities, and collaborative spirit required for the Associate Software Engineer role at Firstsource.

1. Application Screening (Duration: 1 week)

  • What happens: Candidates submit their resumes and cover letters through the Firstsource job portal. The HR team reviews applications, focusing on relevant skills, experience, and educational qualifications.
  • Who's involved: HR team
  • Evaluation criteria: Alignment with job description requirements, technical skills, relevant experience, and communication skills demonstrated in the application materials.
  • Candidate expectations: Submit a well-structured resume and cover letter highlighting relevant skills and experience.

2. Online Coding Assessment (Duration: 2 days)

  • What happens: Shortlisted candidates complete an online coding assessment platform (e.g., HackerRank, Codility) testing their proficiency in programming languages (Java, .NET, Python, Node.js), data structures, algorithms, and problem-solving abilities.
  • Who's involved: Technical team, HR team
  • Evaluation criteria: Code quality, efficiency, problem-solving approach, and adherence to best practices.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare for coding challenges and practice solving problems related to the required technologies.

3. Technical Interview (Duration: 1 week)

  • What happens: Candidates selected from the coding assessment participate in a technical interview with a software engineer or team lead. The interview focuses on in-depth technical knowledge, experience with relevant technologies, understanding of software development principles, and problem-solving skills.
  • Who's involved: Software engineer/team lead, HR representative
  • Evaluation criteria: Technical expertise, problem-solving abilities, communication skills, and cultural fit.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare to discuss technical projects, demonstrate coding knowledge, and articulate solutions to technical challenges.

4. Behavioral Interview (Duration: 1 week)

  • What happens: Candidates who successfully complete the technical interview participate in a behavioral interview with an HR representative or hiring manager. This interview assesses soft skills, teamwork, communication, adaptability, and cultural fit.
  • Who's involved: HR representative/hiring manager
  • Evaluation criteria: Communication skills, teamwork, problem-solving approach, adaptability, and cultural fit.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare to discuss past experiences, provide examples of teamwork and problem-solving, and demonstrate alignment with Firstsource's values.

5. Final Decision and Offer (Duration: 1 week)

  • What happens: The hiring team reviews all interview feedback and makes a final decision. The selected candidate receives a formal job offer outlining compensation, benefits, and start date.
  • Who's involved: Hiring manager, HR team
  • Evaluation criteria: Overall performance in all stages, alignment with job requirements, and cultural fit.
  • Candidate expectations: Respond to the job offer promptly and negotiate terms if necessary.

This comprehensive selection process ensures Firstsource hires qualified and suitable candidates who will contribute to the company's success.

qualification:

This comprehensive breakdown outlines the typical qualifications and requirements for a Software Engineer – Java Full Stack position at New Relic.

Technical Skills

  • Java Proficiency (Expert Level): A deep understanding of Java programming language, including object-oriented principles, design patterns, and multithreading. This is essential for developing robust and scalable backend applications using Java frameworks.

Education & Experience

job_description:
Software Engineer – Java Full Stack at New Relic

About New Relic

New Relic is a leading provider of observability solutions, empowering organizations to monitor and understand the performance, behavior, and health of their software applications.

Job Summary

New Relic is seeking a talented and motivated Software Engineer – Java Full Stack to join our growing engineering team. In this role, you will contribute to the development and maintenance of our cutting-edge API platform, playing a crucial role in delivering exceptional user experiences.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and implement robust backend solutions using Java, focusing on building reusable components and ensuring scalability.
  • Contribute to the enhancement and maintenance of existing features within the API catalog, ensuring seamless functionality and performance.
  • Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including product managers, designers, and other engineers, to contribute to the evolution of API gateway functionalities.
  • Write clean, well-documented, and maintainable code adhering to SOLID principles and industry best practices.
  • Actively participate in code reviews, providing constructive feedback and ensuring code quality.
  • Stay abreast of emerging technologies and industry trends in API management and software development.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field.
  • Proven experience in full-stack development, with a strong foundation in Java and related technologies.
  • Understanding of API management principles, including security, performance, and communication protocols.
  • Familiarity with distributed systems and microservices architecture.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and a passion for delivering high-quality software solutions.

Desirable Skills

  • Experience with React or other frontend frameworks.
  • Knowledge of cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
  • Exposure to AI and its applications in software development.
  • Enthusiasm for learning new technologies and contributing to an innovative environment.
key_responsibility:
Software Engineer – Java Full Stack: Key Responsibilities

This role focuses on building and maintaining software solutions within New Relic, primarily emphasizing backend development using Java and React for frontend components.

Backend Development:

  • Develop End-to-End Solutions: Design, develop, and implement backend functionalities for New Relic's software products. This includes writing clean, efficient, and scalable Java code to handle business logic, data processing, and API interactions.
  • Create Reusable Components: Design and develop reusable Java components and libraries that can be integrated across different parts of the platform. This promotes code reusability, maintainability, and consistency.
  • Enhance and Maintain API Catalog: Contribute to the ongoing development and maintenance of New Relic's API catalog. This involves updating existing APIs, adding new functionalities, and ensuring their stability and performance.

API Gateway Collaboration:

  • Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams: Work closely with other engineering teams, product managers, and designers to understand API requirements, design solutions, and integrate functionalities into the API gateway.
  • Contribute to API Gateway Evolution: Participate in discussions and contribute to the evolution of the API gateway's functionalities. This may involve researching new technologies, proposing improvements, and implementing new features.

Coding Standards and Best Practices:

  • Adhere to Coding Standards: Write clean, well-documented, and maintainable Java code that adheres to established coding standards and best practices. This ensures code readability, consistency, and ease of debugging.
  • Embrace SOLID Principles: Apply SOLID principles (Single Responsibility, Open/Closed, Liskov Substitution, Interface Segregation, Dependency Inversion) to design modular, reusable, and maintainable code.
  • Learn from Senior Developers: Actively seek guidance and mentorship from senior developers to learn industry best practices, gain valuable insights, and enhance technical skills.

New Relic is a leading cloud-based observability platform that empowers organizations to monitor, understand, and optimize their software performance. With a comprehensive suite of tools, New Relic provides deep insights into application behavior, infrastructure health, and user experience, enabling businesses to deliver exceptional digital experiences.

Mission: New Relic's mission is to make software observability accessible to everyone, regardless of their technical expertise. They strive to empower developers, operations teams, and business leaders with the data and insights they need to build, run, and scale high-performing applications.

selection_process:
New Relic Software Engineer – Java Full Stack Hiring Workflow

This multi-stage process aims to identify candidates with the technical skills, problem-solving abilities, and cultural fit required for success as a Software Engineer at New Relic.

1. Application Screening (1 week)

  • What happens: Resumes and cover letters are reviewed against the job description requirements.
  • Who's involved: Recruiting team and hiring manager.
  • Duration: 1 week.
  • Evaluation criteria: Relevant education, experience, technical skills, and alignment with job responsibilities.
  • Candidate expectations: Submit a well-crafted resume and cover letter highlighting relevant experience and skills.

2. Technical Phone Screening (2 days)

  • What happens: A 30-minute phone call with a recruiter or technical specialist to assess basic technical knowledge and problem-solving abilities.
  • Who's involved: Recruiter or technical specialist.
  • Duration: 30 minutes.
  • Evaluation criteria: Understanding of Java fundamentals, API concepts, and software development principles.
  • Candidate expectations: Be prepared to discuss technical experience and answer basic coding questions.

3. Online Coding Assessment (3 days)

  • What happens: Candidates complete a timed online coding challenge designed to evaluate their problem-solving skills and coding proficiency in Java.
  • Who's involved: Hiring manager and/or technical team.
  • Duration: 2-3 hours.
  • Evaluation criteria: Code quality, efficiency, adherence to best practices, and ability to solve complex problems.
  • Candidate expectations: Demonstrate strong coding skills and problem-solving abilities within the given time constraints.

4. Technical Interview (1 week)

  • What happens: A 1-hour video interview with a senior engineer to delve deeper into technical skills, experience, and problem-solving approach.
  • Who's involved: Senior Software Engineer.
  • Duration: 1 hour.
  • Evaluation criteria: Technical expertise, communication skills, ability to articulate solutions, and cultural fit.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare to discuss technical projects in detail, solve coding problems collaboratively, and demonstrate a passion for learning and growth.

5. Culture Fit Interview (1 week)

  • What happens: A 30-minute video interview with a member of the HR team or hiring manager to assess cultural fit, values alignment, and team dynamics.
  • Who's involved: HR representative or hiring manager.
  • Duration: 30 minutes.
  • Evaluation criteria: Communication style, teamwork skills, adaptability, and alignment with New Relic's values.
  • Candidate expectations: Be prepared to discuss their work style, team preferences, and how they contribute to a positive work environment.

6. Final Decision (1 week)

  • What happens: The hiring team reviews all interview feedback and makes a final decision.
  • Who's involved: Hiring manager and relevant stakeholders.
  • Duration: 1 week.
  • Evaluation criteria: Overall candidate profile, technical skills, cultural fit, and alignment with team needs.
  • Candidate expectations: Receive a decision regarding their candidacy within the specified timeframe.

qualification:
BI Specialist (2025 Grads.) - Typical Qualifications & Requirements

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree in a Relevant Field: A strong foundation in data analysis, statistics, computer science, or a related field is essential. This degree equips candidates with the theoretical knowledge and analytical skills necessary to interpret complex data sets and derive meaningful insights.

  • Strong Academic Performance: A consistent record of academic excellence demonstrates a candidate's ability to grasp complex concepts, solve problems, and work independently.

Technical Skills:

  • Data Analysis Tools: Proficiency in tools like SQL, Python (with libraries like Pandas and NumPy), R, or Tableau is crucial. These tools enable the BI Specialist to extract, manipulate, analyze, and visualize data effectively.

  • Database Management: Understanding of relational databases and SQL queries is essential for accessing, querying, and managing large datasets.

  • Data Visualization: Ability to create clear, concise, and insightful visualizations using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms is vital for communicating data-driven findings to stakeholders.

  • Statistical Concepts: A solid grasp of statistical concepts like hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and data mining techniques is necessary for drawing accurate conclusions from data.

Soft Skills:

  • Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills are essential for presenting findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.

  • Problem-Solving: The ability to identify patterns, analyze data, and solve complex business problems using data-driven insights is crucial.

  • Collaboration: BI Specialists often work in teams with other analysts, developers, and business stakeholders. Strong teamwork and collaboration skills are essential.

  • Attention to Detail: Accuracy and precision are paramount when working with data. A keen eye for detail ensures the reliability and integrity of analyses.

These qualifications provide a comprehensive framework for evaluating candidates for the BI Specialist role at Loyalty Juggernaut.
job_description:
BI Specialist (2025 Grads.)

Company: Loyalty Juggernaut

Location: [City, State]

About Loyalty Juggernaut:

Loyalty Juggernaut is a leading provider of innovative loyalty and customer engagement solutions for enterprise-level clients. We empower businesses to build lasting relationships with their customers through data-driven strategies and cutting-edge technology.

Job Summary:

As a Business Intelligence (BI) Specialist, you will be a key member of our team, transforming complex data into actionable insights that drive strategic decision-making. This role requires a blend of technical expertise and business acumen to develop scalable dashboards, reports, and advanced analytics solutions tailored to the unique needs of our clients in the loyalty and customer engagement space.

Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and implement key performance indicators (KPIs) aligned with client objectives across various sectors within the loyalty and customer engagement domain.
  • Design, develop, and optimize complex SQL queries to ensure high-performing, efficient reporting and data extraction from large-scale databases.
  • Leverage artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) models to provide predictive insights, including sales forecasting, customer churn prediction, fraud detection, and recommendations for optimizing loyalty strategies.
  • Interpret and transform raw data from data warehouses into meaningful, actionable insights for stakeholders.
  • Design and build interactive reports and dashboards using leading business intelligence tools such as Amazon QuickSight, Power BI, or Tableau, effectively communicating complex data visualizations.

Qualifications:

  • Pursuing or holding a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field with a strong academic record.
  • Expected graduation year: 2024 or 2025.
  • Hands-on experience with Amazon QuickSight or similar BI tools (Power BI, Tableau) is essential.
  • Demonstrated ability to analyze data trends and deliver insightful interpretations and actionable recommendations.
  • Solid foundation in SQL, ETL processes, and working with large-scale databases.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to effectively present technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities of a BI Specialist (2025 Grads.) at Loyalty Juggernaut

Data Analysis & Interpretation:

  • Define and Implement KPIs: Collaborate with stakeholders to identify and define key performance indicators (KPIs) specific to the loyalty and customer engagement domain across various sectors. This involves understanding business objectives and translating them into measurable metrics.
  • Develop SQL Queries: Write and optimize complex SQL queries to extract relevant data from large-scale databases for reporting and analysis. Ensure queries are efficient, accurate, and scalable to handle growing data volumes.
  • Leverage AI/ML: Utilize AI/ML models to uncover hidden patterns and trends within customer data. This includes applying models for tasks like sales forecasting, customer churn prediction, fraud detection, and generating recommendations for loyalty program strategies.
  • Transform Raw Data: Interpret raw data from data warehouses and transform it into actionable insights. This involves cleaning, structuring, and analyzing data to identify meaningful trends and correlations.

Reporting & Visualization:

  • Design & Build Reports: Create comprehensive reports and dashboards using leading business intelligence tools like Amazon QuickSight, Power BI, or Tableau. Reports should effectively communicate key findings, trends, and insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
  • Present Findings: Communicate data-driven insights and recommendations to stakeholders through compelling presentations and visualizations. Effectively translate complex technical information into business-oriented language.

Continuous Improvement:

  • Stay Updated: Continuously research and learn about new BI tools, techniques, and industry best practices. Adapt and implement new technologies to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of BI solutions.
  • Collaborate & Contribute: Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams, including marketing, sales, and product development, to understand their data needs and provide tailored solutions.
