qualification:
SASKEN - Engineer - Software Test & Release: Typical Qualifications & Requirements

This section outlines the typical qualifications and requirements for the Engineer - Software Test & Release position at SASKEN.

I. Education & Experience

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field: A strong foundation in computer science principles is essential for understanding software development processes and testing methodologies.
  • 3+ years of experience in software testing and release engineering: This demonstrates practical experience in designing, executing, and managing software testing processes, as well as experience in deploying and releasing software applications.

II. Technical Skills

  • Proficiency in software testing methodologies (e.g., black-box, white-box, grey-box): The ability to apply various testing techniques to ensure comprehensive software quality is crucial.
  • Experience with test automation frameworks (e.g., Selenium, Appium): Automating test cases significantly improves efficiency and reduces manual effort in the testing process.
  • Knowledge of version control systems (e.g., Git): Version control is essential for managing code changes, collaborating with developers, and tracking software releases.
  • Familiarity with continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines: Understanding CI/CD principles allows for streamlined and automated software releases.
  • Scripting skills (e.g., Python, Bash): Scripting is valuable for automating tasks, analyzing test results, and customizing testing environments.

III. Soft Skills

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills: Identifying and resolving software defects requires critical thinking and analytical abilities.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills: Effective communication with developers, product managers, and other stakeholders is essential for successful software testing and release.
  • Attention to detail and a commitment to quality: Thoroughness and a focus on delivering high-quality software are paramount in this role.

These qualifications provide a comprehensive overview of the typical requirements for the Engineer - Software Test & Release position at SASKEN.
job_description:
Engineer - Software Test & Release

Company: SASKEN

Job Summary

This role is an entry-level position within SASKEN's engineering team, focusing on the testing and release of software solutions. The successful candidate will demonstrate a foundational understanding of software development principles and possess a strong aptitude for technical problem-solving. They will work closely with senior engineers and team leads to ensure the quality and timely delivery of software products.

Roles & Responsibilities

  • Design, code, test, debug, document, and provide technical support for assigned software modules within defined project timelines.
  • Adhere to established coding standards, review checklists, and organizational processes to ensure consistent quality and efficiency.
  • Execute test plans, analyze test results, and report defects to the development team.
  • Collaborate with team members to resolve technical issues and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives.
  • Participate in code reviews and knowledge sharing sessions to enhance technical expertise.
  • Stay abreast of industry best practices and emerging technologies through training, self-learning, and technical evaluations.

Education and Experience

  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering (Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field), MCA, or equivalent.
  • 0 to 2 years of experience in software development or testing.

Competency Overview

  • Protocol Testing Expertise:
    • Conduct protocol stack testing for modems and user equipment (UE).
    • Execute interoperability testing between modems and various network providers, including interaction with Network Equipment Manufacturers (NEMs) such as Ericsson, Nokia, and Alcatel-Lucent.
    • Understand signaling and user plane call flows, create and run test plans using automated frameworks, and analyze logs for debugging and issue resolution.
  • Technical Proficiency:
    • Strong grasp of 3GPP Radio Access Technologies, including air interface, signaling protocols, and Layer 2/3 for both UE and RAN, as well as the NAS layer from the UE to the core network.
    • Experience with automation using scripting languages such as PERL, Python, and TTCN.
  • Platform Familiarity:
    • Experience with internal and customer-specific platforms, primarily Linux-based systems.
  • Tool Expertise:
    • Hands-on experience with tools like QXDM, QCAT, QPST, Prism, Anritsu, and Keysight.
    • Proficient in using test scripting tools such as RTD (for Anritsu) and equivalents.
    • Familiar with trace and log analysis tools, core dump analysis tools, and flashing utilities.
  • Programming & Scripting Languages:
    • Proficient in Shell scripting, TCL, Python, Perl, and programming languages like C, C++, and TTCN.

Areas of Expertise

  • Specialized knowledge in 2G, 3G, 4G, 5G technologies, interoperability testing, and VSAT-SATCOM.
key_responsibility:
Engineer - Software Test & Release: Key Responsibilities

I. Protocol Testing & Analysis

  • Conduct Protocol Stack Testing: Execute comprehensive tests on modem/UE (User Equipment) to validate adherence to 2G, 3G, LTE, and 5G protocols. This involves analyzing protocol interactions, identifying potential issues, and ensuring seamless communication between the modem and the network.
  • Interoperability Testing: Perform interoperability testing between modems and various network providers, including interaction with Network Equipment Manufacturers (NEMs) like Ericsson, Nokia, and Alcatel-Lucent. This ensures compatibility and seamless data exchange across different network infrastructures.
  • Call Flow Analysis & Debugging: Understand and analyze signaling and user plane call flows to identify bottlenecks or inconsistencies. Utilize automated test frameworks to create and execute test plans, collect logs, and perform in-depth debugging during regression cycles.

II. Test Automation & Scripting

  • Develop & Execute Test Scripts: Utilize scripting languages such as PERL, Python, and TTCN to automate test cases, streamline testing processes, and enhance efficiency.
  • Framework Development & Maintenance: Contribute to the development and maintenance of automated test frameworks, ensuring they are robust, scalable, and aligned with evolving testing needs.

III. Documentation & Reporting

  • Test Plan & Report Generation: Create detailed test plans outlining test objectives, methodologies, and expected outcomes. Generate comprehensive test reports documenting test results, identified issues, and proposed solutions.
  • Technical Documentation: Contribute to the creation and maintenance of technical documentation related to testing procedures, protocols, and tools.

IV. Continuous Learning & Improvement

  • Technical Skill Enhancement: Actively pursue opportunities for professional development through training programs, self-learning initiatives, and participation in technical evaluations.
  • Process Optimization: Identify opportunities to improve testing processes, workflows, and tool utilization, contributing to enhanced efficiency and effectiveness.

V. Collaboration & Communication

  • Teamwork: Collaborate effectively with team members, engineers, and project managers to ensure seamless execution of testing activities and timely delivery of results.
  • Communication: Communicate test results, findings, and potential issues clearly and concisely to relevant stakeholders, both verbally and in writing.

selection_process:
SASKEN Hiring Workflow: ENGINEER-SOFTWARE TEST&RELEASE

This multi-stage process aims to identify candidates with the technical expertise, problem-solving skills, and collaborative spirit required for the ENGINEER-SOFTWARE TEST&RELEASE role at SASKEN.

1. Application Screening (1 week)

  • What happens: Resumes and cover letters are reviewed against pre-defined criteria focusing on education, experience, and relevant skills (e.g., programming languages, testing tools, 3GPP knowledge).
  • Who's involved: HR team and hiring manager.
  • Duration: 1 week.
  • Evaluation criteria: Alignment with job description requirements, demonstrable technical skills, and relevant experience.
  • Candidate expectations: Submit a well-structured resume and cover letter highlighting relevant qualifications.

2. Online Assessments (2 weeks)

  • What happens: Shortlisted candidates complete online assessments covering technical skills (e.g., coding challenges, protocol knowledge quizzes), logical reasoning, and problem-solving abilities.
  • Who's involved: Candidates and automated assessment platform.
  • Duration: 2 weeks.
  • Evaluation criteria: Performance on technical assessments, problem-solving aptitude, and attention to detail.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare for technical challenges and demonstrate proficiency in relevant areas.

3. Technical Interview (1 week)

  • What happens: Candidates participate in a technical interview with a senior engineer or team lead, focusing on in-depth discussions about their technical skills, experience with testing methodologies, and understanding of 3GPP standards.
  • Who's involved: Candidate and senior engineer/team lead.
  • Duration: 1 week (scheduling may vary).
  • Evaluation criteria: Technical knowledge, problem-solving skills, communication abilities, and alignment with SASKEN's technical environment.
  • Candidate expectations: Prepare to discuss technical projects, demonstrate problem-solving approaches, and articulate their understanding of relevant technologies.

4. Cultural Fit Interview (1 week)

  • What happens: Candidates participate in a behavioral interview with an HR representative or hiring manager, assessing their cultural fit within SASKEN's team environment, work ethic, and communication style.
  • Who's involved: Candidate and HR representative/hiring manager.
  • Duration: 1 week (scheduling may vary).
  • Evaluation criteria: Teamwork skills, communication style, adaptability, and alignment with SASKEN's values.
  • Candidate expectations: Showcase their personality, highlight their collaborative strengths, and demonstrate enthusiasm for joining SASKEN's team.

5. Decision & Offer (1 week)

  • What happens: The hiring team reviews all assessment results and interview feedback to make a final decision. A job offer is extended to the selected candidate.
  • Who's involved: Hiring team and HR department.
  • Duration: 1 week.
  • Evaluation criteria: Overall performance across all stages, alignment with job requirements, and cultural fit.
  • Candidate expectations: Receive a formal job offer outlining compensation, benefits, and start date.

About Sony

Sony is a global leader in entertainment and technology, renowned for its innovative products and services that inspire and delight millions worldwide. From groundbreaking electronics and immersive gaming experiences to captivating movies and music, Sony continues to push the boundaries of what's possible.

With a rich history of innovation spanning over seven decades, Sony's commitment to technological advancement and creative excellence remains unwavering. The company's diverse portfolio encompasses a wide range of businesses, including:

selection_process:
SONY Full Stack Engineer Hiring Workflow

Phase 1: Application Screening (AI-powered)

  • AI analyzes resumes against job requirements, prioritizing candidates based on skills, experience, and qualifications.
  • Shortlisted candidates receive an automated email inviting them to the next stage.

Phase 2: Online Assessment (Technical & Behavioral)

  • Candidates complete a series of technical assessments testing their coding skills, problem-solving abilities, and knowledge of relevant technologies.
  • A behavioral assessment evaluates communication, teamwork, and problem-solving skills.

Phase 3: Video Interview (AI-assisted)

  • Top-performing candidates participate in a structured video interview, leveraging AI for initial screening and identifying strong candidates for human review.

Phase 4: In-Person Interview (Technical & Cultural Fit)

  • Selected candidates meet with the hiring manager and team members for in-depth technical discussions and cultural fit assessments.

Phase 5: Reference Checks & Decision

  • Finalists undergo reference checks to verify experience and suitability.
  • The hiring team makes a final decision based on the comprehensive evaluation process.

Phase 6: Offer & Onboarding

  • The selected candidate receives a formal job offer outlining compensation and benefits.
  • A smooth onboarding process ensures a successful transition into the role.

job_description:
Data Analyst - Capgemini

About the Role:

Capgemini is seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. You will leverage your expertise in Python and machine learning to analyze complex datasets, develop predictive models, and drive data-driven insights.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and implement machine learning models using libraries like TensorFlow, Keras, and scikit-learn.
  • Apply clustering and classification algorithms for tasks such as data grouping and image recognition.
  • Utilize Natural Language Processing (NLP) techniques and build recommendation systems.
  • Design and optimize database schemas in relational and non-relational databases (e.g., MySQL).
  • Collaborate with Agile Scrum teams, utilizing version control systems (e.g., Git).
  • Evaluate model performance and communicate findings effectively.

Qualifications:

  • Advanced Python programming skills.
  • Strong proficiency in machine learning libraries and frameworks.
  • Experience with data modeling and database design.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities

  • Data Analysis & Modeling: Analyze large datasets, identify trends and patterns, and develop predictive models using machine learning algorithms.
  • Algorithm Implementation: Implement and fine-tune clustering, classification, and other machine learning algorithms for various applications, including image recognition and recommendation systems.
  • Database Management: Design, optimize, and manage relational and non-relational databases, ensuring efficient data retrieval and storage.
  • Model Deployment & Monitoring: Deploy trained machine learning models into production environments and monitor their performance.
  • Collaboration & Communication: Work effectively within an Agile Scrum team, contributing to code reviews, sprint planning, and knowledge sharing.
  • Documentation & Reporting: Document data analysis processes, model development, and findings in a clear and concise manner.
about_company:
About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global leader in consulting, technology services, and digital transformation. With over 300,000 people in more than 50 countries, we partner with clients across all sectors to help them navigate the complexities of the digital age.

We believe in the power of technology to create a more equitable and sustainable future. Our purpose is to unleash the human potential through technology, and we are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace where everyone can thrive.

At Capgemini, we are driven by innovation and a passion for excellence. We are constantly exploring new technologies and ways to deliver value to our clients. Our collaborative culture encourages creativity and empowers our people to make a real difference.
selection_process:
Capgemini Data Analyst Selection Process

Capgemini's selection process for the Data Analyst role prioritizes technical proficiency and collaborative skills.

1. Application Review: Candidates will be screened based on their resume and cover letter, focusing on relevant experience with Python, machine learning libraries, and database technologies.

2. Technical Assessment: Shortlisted candidates will complete a technical assessment evaluating their coding skills, machine learning knowledge, and problem-solving abilities.

3. Virtual Interview: Successful candidates will participate in a virtual interview with a hiring manager and team member. This stage will delve deeper into technical expertise, project experience, and communication skills.

4. Case Study: Finalists will be presented with a real-world data analysis case study, requiring them to demonstrate their analytical thinking, problem-solving, and communication skills.

5. Final Interview: The final stage involves an interview with senior leadership, focusing on cultural fit, career aspirations, and long-term contributions to Capgemini.

This comprehensive process ensures Capgemini selects the most qualified and suitable candidates for the Data Analyst role.

job_description:
Associate Software Engineer

About Optum

Optum is a leading health services and innovation company dedicated to improving healthcare delivery through technology, data analytics, and clinical expertise. As part of the UnitedHealth Group, Optum offers a comprehensive suite of services, including healthcare management, pharmacy care, and consulting.

Job Description

We are seeking a talented and motivated Associate Software Engineer to join our growing team. In this role, you will play a key part in developing and maintaining scalable data pipelines that process large volumes of healthcare data. You will leverage your expertise in cloud-native technologies and DataOps methodologies to ensure efficient, reliable, and secure data management.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, build, and deploy data pipelines using cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud) for data ingestion, transformation, and cleansing.
  • Automate data workflows using Airflow, executing tasks on Kubernetes or Hadoop.
  • Build and deploy Docker containers for applications within Kubernetes environments.
  • Engineer efficient processes for data cleaning, normalization, and preparation.
  • Fine-tune and optimize existing data workflows for performance improvement.
  • Implement DataOps best practices, including CI/CD pipelines, orchestration, automated testing, and system monitoring.
  • Transition legacy on-premise solutions to cloud platforms, enhancing engineering operations.
  • Develop robust data quality monitoring systems to ensure data product quality.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field.
  • Strong background in managing real-time, near real-time, and batch data ingestion processes.
  • Hands-on experience building data pipelines using cloud-native tools and deployment best practices.
  • Proficiency in DataOps methodologies, including CI/CD, orchestration, testing, and monitoring.
  • Practical knowledge of Apache Spark, SQL, ETL/data workflows, and relevant open-source technologies (Python, Scala, Java, Linux).
  • Solid understanding of data modeling concepts (Data Vault, Kimball star schema).
  • Experience with columnar databases (Snowflake, Redshift, Databricks, Vertica, ClickHouse).
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and maintain scalable data pipelines: Design, build, and implement efficient data pipelines to ingest, transform, and process large volumes of data.
  • Automate data workflows: Utilize Airflow to schedule and automate data workflows, leveraging Kubernetes or Hadoop for execution across various stages of data processing.
  • Containerize and deploy applications: Build and deploy Docker containers for multiple applications within Kubernetes environments, ensuring seamless integration and scalability.
  • Ensure data quality: Engineer robust processes for data cleansing, normalization, and preparation, ensuring data accuracy and reliability.
  • Optimize data performance: Continuously fine-tune and enhance existing data workflows to improve efficiency and performance.
  • Champion DataOps best practices: Promote and implement DataOps principles, including CI/CD pipelines, orchestration, automated testing, and system monitoring.
  • Modernize engineering operations: Contribute to the standardization and migration of legacy on-premise solutions to cloud platforms, enhancing operational efficiency.
  • Monitor data quality: Implement and maintain robust data quality monitoring systems to ensure all data products meet or exceed user expectations.
about_company:
About Optum

Optum is a leading health services and innovation company dedicated to improving healthcare delivery through the power of technology, data analytics, and clinical expertise. As part of the UnitedHealth Group, Optum offers a comprehensive suite of services, including healthcare management, pharmacy care, and consulting.

By leveraging data-driven insights and cutting-edge solutions, Optum empowers healthcare providers to enhance patient outcomes, streamline operations, and reduce costs. Their commitment to transforming healthcare makes Optum a driving force in the shift towards value-based care, shaping a healthier future for all.
selection_process:
Optum Associate Software Engineer Hiring Workflow

1. Application Review: AI-powered screening analyzes resumes and cover letters for relevant keywords and qualifications.

2. Initial Screening: A recruiter conducts phone interviews to assess basic qualifications, experience, and cultural fit.

3. Technical Assessment: Candidates complete a coding challenge or technical test to evaluate their skills in data processing, pipeline development, and relevant technologies.

4. Interview Rounds:

  • Behavioral Interview: Focuses on past experiences, problem-solving abilities, and teamwork skills.
  • Technical Interview: Dives deeper into technical expertise, data modeling knowledge, and cloud platform experience.
  • System Design Interview: Evaluates the candidate's ability to design and architect scalable data solutions.

5. Reference Checks: Verifying candidate's experience and work ethic through previous employers.

6. Final Decision: Hiring manager makes the final decision based on the candidate's overall performance throughout the process.

7. Offer & Onboarding: Successful candidates receive a formal job offer and begin the onboarding process.

job_description:
Trainee Business Associate

About Porter

Porter is a leading logistics company dedicated to providing efficient and reliable delivery solutions.

Job Description

As a Trainee Business Associate, you will play a crucial role in expanding Porter's network of delivery partners. You will be responsible for identifying and onboarding new partners, ensuring a smooth activation process, and fostering strong relationships to drive partner satisfaction and success.

Responsibilities:

  • Identify and cultivate potential partners through fieldwork and referrals.
  • Develop short-term engagement strategies with prospective partners to enhance onboarding success.
  • Recruit long-distance delivery partners capable of handling orders exceeding 75 km.
  • Facilitate a streamlined and efficient activation process for new partners.
  • Build and maintain strong relationships with onboarded partners, providing support and addressing operational challenges.
  • Gather and share partner insights, feedback, and market trends with senior leadership to improve onboarding processes and overall partner satisfaction.
  • Conduct market research in untapped areas to identify growth opportunities and assess partner presence.

Qualifications:

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
  • Proven ability to manage multiple stakeholders effectively.
  • In-depth knowledge of the local market.
  • Experience in field operations is preferred.
key_responsibility:
Key Responsibilities

As a Trainee Business Associate at Porter, you will:

  • Lead Generation & Partner Acquisition: Identify and cultivate potential partners through fieldwork and referrals. Develop initial engagement strategies to ensure smooth onboarding.
  • Partner Onboarding & Activation: Recruit long-distance delivery partners capable of handling orders exceeding 75 km. Streamline the activation process for new partners, ensuring a quick and efficient transition.
  • Partner Relationship Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with onboarded partners. Provide ongoing support and address operational challenges they may face.
  • Market Research & Analysis: Conduct market research in untapped areas to identify growth opportunities, assess partner presence, and analyze key market factors.
  • Feedback & Insights: Share valuable partner insights, feedback, and emerging trends with senior leadership to continuously improve the onboarding process and enhance overall partner satisfaction.
about_company:
About Porter

Porter is a leading logistics platform revolutionizing the delivery landscape. We connect businesses with a network of reliable and efficient delivery partners, ensuring seamless and timely delivery of goods across diverse locations.

Driven by innovation and a commitment to excellence, Porter empowers businesses to scale their operations and reach new markets. Our technology-driven platform streamlines the entire delivery process, from order placement to real-time tracking, providing transparency and control for both businesses and customers.

At Porter, we believe in fostering strong partnerships and empowering our delivery partners to succeed. We are dedicated to creating a supportive and collaborative environment where individuals can grow and contribute to our mission of transforming the future of logistics.
selection_process:
Porter Trainee Business Associate Selection Process

Porter's selection process for the Trainee Business Associate role prioritizes identifying candidates with strong interpersonal skills, market knowledge, and a drive to succeed.

1. Application Review: Applications will be screened based on submitted resumes and cover letters, focusing on relevant experience, skills, and qualifications.

2. Online Assessment: Shortlisted candidates will complete an online assessment evaluating their communication, analytical, and problem-solving abilities.

3. Phone Interview: Successful candidates will participate in a phone interview to further assess their communication skills, understanding of the role, and motivation.

4. In-Person Interview: Top candidates will be invited for an in-person interview with the hiring manager and team members. This stage will delve deeper into their experience, skills, and cultural fit within Porter.

5. Reference Checks: Finalists will undergo reference checks to verify their previous work experience and performance.

6. Offer & Onboarding: Successful candidates will receive a formal job offer and participate in a comprehensive onboarding program to ensure a smooth transition into their new role.
